titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Elizabeth Feldhusen records on the Brooklyn Park Advisory Committee 1988.050
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-09-20 19:14:40 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Elizabeth Feldhusen records on the Brooklyn Park Advisory Committee

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn Park Advisory Committee (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: The collection includes reports, studies, proposals, minutes, agendas, and letters covering the participation of Elizabeth Feldhusen in the Brooklyn Park Advisory Committee, specifically pertaining to the improvement of Prospect Park.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material is arranged into three folders by type.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Elizabeth Feldhusen records on the Brooklyn Park Advisory Committee, 1988.050, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes reports, studies, proposals, minutes, agendas, and letters covering the participation of Elizabeth Feldhusen in the Brooklyn Park Advisory Committee, specifically pertaining to the improvement of Prospect Park.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
